fields.title: Humanitarian Update Syrian Arab Republic - Issue 10 | March 2023
fields.body:
HIGHLIGHTS 

P.01 UN continues to assist earthquake-affected people in Syria 

P.02 UN extends support to flood-impacted population in north-east Syria 

P.03 Earthquake undermines Syria’s economic outlook, compounding dire socio-economic conditions, and internal displacement 

- Impact of the earthquakes on employment and the labour market in Syria 

P.04 Briefing to the security council on the humanitarian situation in Syria 

- Half of Syria's popultion faces hunger 

P.05 (RC/HC a.i.), El-Mostafa Benlamlih statement on the Aleppo International Airport strikes 

- Inter-sectoral assessment mission to Ash-Sheikh Maqsoud 

P.06 Earthquakes impact on Southern region 

P.07 Impact of low level of Euphrates river and rainfall on farmers 

- Alternative water supply to Al-Hasakeh 

Q.08 Population movements 

- Weather conditions impact Homs and Hama 

- ''Axed and burned'', impact of deforestation in Syria

text:
# Humanitarian Update Syrian Arab Republic - Issue 10 | March 2023

HIGHLIGHTS 

P.01 UN continues to assist earthquake-affected people in Syria 

P.02 UN extends support to flood-impacted population in north-east Syria 

P.03 Earthquake undermines Syria’s economic outlook, compounding dire socio-economic conditions, and internal displacement 

- Impact of the earthquakes on employment and the labour market in Syria 

P.04 Briefing to the security council on the humanitarian situation in Syria 

- Half of Syria's popultion faces hunger 

P.05 (RC/HC a.i.), El-Mostafa Benlamlih statement on the Aleppo International Airport strikes 

- Inter-sectoral assessment mission to Ash-Sheikh Maqsoud 

P.06 Earthquakes impact on Southern region 

P.07 Impact of low level of Euphrates river and rainfall on farmers 

- Alternative water supply to Al-Hasakeh 

Q.08 Population movements 

- Weather conditions impact Homs and Hama 

- ''Axed and burned'', impact of deforestation in Syria
summary: This issue of the Humanitarian Update for the Syrian Arab Republic highlights the ongoing assistance provided by the UN to those affected by earthquakes and floods in the region. It also outlines the dire socio-economic conditions and internal displacement caused by the earthquakes, as well as the impact of the Aleppo International Airport strikes and the low level of the Euphrates river and rainfall on farmers. Additionally, it discusses the population movements and the impact of deforestation in Syria.
